channel.title: 纽约时报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Breaking News: David Perdue, a former U.S. senator and an ally of Donald Trump, is expected to challenge Gov. Brian Kemp in the Republican primary for governor of Georgia. https://t.co/jfGg9NLMHH

The U.S. is close to having more than 200 million people fully vaccinated against the coronavirus.
198 million residents — almost 60% of the population — were fully vaccinated as of Saturday, according to the CDC. https://t.co/03hmZgXHEx

How does Denzel Washington maintain an air of mystery in this oversharing era?
“If they see you free all week, they won’t pay to see you on the weekend,” the star told @maureendowd . “I don’t tweet. I don’t have Instagram. I embrace my inner analog.” https://t.co/fytrJQ7qLv
Nathaniel Woods never touched the gun used to kill three Birmingham police officers in 2004. Alabama still sentenced him to die for his role in the murders. https://t.co/9OScOPZIxp

Bob Dole, who overcame grievous war wounds to become one of the longest-serving Republican leaders, died on Sunday at 98. He was the last of the World War II generation to win his party’s nomination for president. https://t.co/azfYozAVMm https://t.co/10x2yO7c5d
Breaking News: Bob Dole is dead at 98. He overcame grievous war wounds to become Senate majority leader, spending decades on the national stage. https://t.co/CNGrngGQck
The parents of a Michigan teenager who fatally shot four students were arrested early Saturday in Detroit, the police said. They face manslaughter charges. https://t.co/EW73ENEG9U

The push to rewrite the Electoral Count Act of 1887 has taken on new urgency as more details have emerged about the extent of former President Trump’s plot to exploit its provisions to cling to power. https://t.co/ubWaXE6ccI

Breaking News: CNN has fired Chris Cuomo on Saturday following the network’s investigation into his efforts to help his brother, Andrew Cuomo, fight off multiple sexual harassment allegations. https://t.co/0QISk1LUr7

“I transitioned in place. And the community came along with me.” Stu Rasmussen, who was believed to be the first openly transgender mayor in America, served in various elected offices in Silverton, Oregon, died last month at 73. https://t.co/tofVAFEuFt https://t.co/rTk3UHjgDX
Our greatest fear is here — we’re running out of schmear. https://t.co/fKjZquEe1y

As a nurse in Biella, Italy, prepared to administer a Covid vaccine on Thursday, she noticed the patient's arm was pinker than his face — then, she touched the arm.
"It was made of rubber foam," she said. https://t.co/zVWY0doJYs

Seven years ago, the Houston megachurch led by Joel Osteen reported that $200,000 in cash and $400,000 in checks had been stolen from a church safe.
Last month, the money may have been discovered by a plumber fixing a toilet inside a church bathroom. https://t.co/SndUvoMYwB
Buried under volcanic ash for weeks, thousands of honeybees in the Canary Islands managed to stay alive, a reminder of the species toughness, scientists said. https://t.co/G8eiIUhDf1

On her third day out with a metal detector, Milly Hardwick, a 13-year-old in England, found an ax from 3,000 years ago along with a hoard of other Bronze Age artifacts.
“I was just shocked,” she said. “We were just laughing our heads off.” https://t.co/iVn4XQkJTV

Susan Rosenblatt, along with her husband and law partner, Stanley, took on Big Tobacco in a Florida case that resulted in a record $144.8 billion jury award in favor of people sickened by cigarettes. She died last month at 70. https://t.co/YRBGK2mC6b

International television got a big boost in the American consciousness this year. These are the best international shows of 2021, according to our critics. https://t.co/mgaLCunBr8 https://t.co/uiKyo7d1HF

Some of the first cases of the Omicron variant of the coronavirus to be detected in Botswana — which were among the first known in the world — were in foreign diplomats who had traveled to the country from Europe, Botswana's president said on Thursday. https://t.co/nsK8enIif2

Data supporting the effectiveness of mask mandates in Missouri was kept private for a month until state public health officials released it this week in response to a public records request. https://t.co/ZOQtJzGDeO

As a nurse in Biella, Italy, prepared to administer a Covid vaccine on Thursday, she noticed the patient's arm was pinker than his face — then, she touched the arm.
"It was made of rubber foam," she said. https://t.co/8PHg1SEZh5

Breaking News: The Omicron variant appears to be spreading more than twice as fast as Delta in South Africa, scientists said. How vaccines affect it — or whether Omicron causes more severe disease than other variants — remains unclear. https://t.co/p9yeVmEzHz
These are the best TV shows of 2021, according to our critics. https://t.co/rM0JR5SGGi https://t.co/MP6xVSFbRb

In Opinion
“The right likes to suggest that abortion is a traumatic experience for women,” writes Elizabeth Spiers, who was adopted as an infant, in a guest essay. “But adoption is often just as traumatic as the right thinks abortion is, if not more so.” https://t.co/jMizWAXvva

Breaking News: The parents of the Michigan school shooting suspect were charged with involuntary manslaughter, a rare step in prosecuting school shootings. https://t.co/i2YsealQkA https://t.co/L5zzjIiXrq

On her third day out with a metal detector, Milly Hardwick, a 13-year-old in England, found an ax from 3,000 years ago along with a hoard of other Bronze Age artifacts.
“I was just shocked,” she said. “We were just laughing our heads off.” https://t.co/lhYqb9PBAN

A commercial featuring Santa holding a vaccine passport has been cleared by British ad regulators, after viewers submitted a near-record number of complaints, saying it promoted vaccination. The ad "doesn't break our rules," a spokesman said. https://t.co/pWf6v7L2Hu

The largest media organizations in the U.S. — including ABC, CBS, CNN, Dow Jones, NBC, The New York Times and The Washington Post — filed a brief on Tuesday asking a court not to bar Steve Bannon from releasing documents related to the Jan. 6 Capitol riot. https://t.co/eqinOHUxyk
Marcus Lamb, a Christian broadcaster in Dallas who had been dismissive of Covid-19 vaccinations, died on Tuesday after contracting the coronavirus, his family said. https://t.co/ZyfRQONa8R

The Democrats’ social policy bill, or Build Back Better, if passed by the Senate, would be the biggest step toward universal coverage since the passage of the Affordable Care Act. Here are some of the programs and people the bill would affect. https://t.co/56BRchQiZK https://t.co/Ecx86yaTnP
Breaking News: Many mix-and-match combinations of booster shots are likely to provide strong protection against the coronavirus, a large study found. https://t.co/hVcwkPFGFY

The NFL on Thursday suspended the Tampa Bay Buccaneers star receiver Antonio Brown and cornerback Mike Edwards without pay for the next three games for misrepresenting their vaccination status. https://t.co/pTJexz3GaZ
The most-used emojis of 2021 are in. What's your favorite emoji? Tell us in the comments. https://t.co/jsAwdYGSiT https://t.co/ZR907iTPBa

Breaking News: New York City will require employees at yeshivas, Catholic schools and other private schools to be vaccinated against the coronavirus. The new directive is expected to affect roughly 930 schools and 56,000 employees, city officials said. https://t.co/77HWJFfBeD

A former Ohio sheriff’s deputy has been charged with murder in the death of Casey Goodson Jr. last year. Goodson, a 23-year-old Black man, was shot several times in the back during an operation that had nothing to do with him, according to an indictment. https://t.co/U5voTep3UQ

Germany announced new rules to prevent unvaccinated people from going to bars and restaurants, or shop anywhere but places like pharmacies or grocery stores to break a soaring fourth wave of Covid and prevent the spread of the Omicron variant. https://t.co/skOiu1CkZC

A Democratic pollster issued a warning to his party ahead of the 2022 elections after holding focus groups with Virginia voters.
"We’ve got a national branding problem that is probably deeper than a lot of people suspect." https://t.co/BVCC8owAmh

Two Georgia election workers who were falsely accused of manipulating ballots during the 2020 election are suing The Gateway Pundit, one of the nation’s leading sources of pro-Trump misinformation for defamation. https://t.co/2U1y5ka5IR

China’s censors have begun scrubbing references to Peng Shuai and the sexual assault allegations she made against a former vice premier from the internet. But her supporters are still finding ways to talk about her. https://t.co/zJScFxtmVL

Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, won a decisive victory in her long-running legal feud with The Mail on Sunday on Thursday, in her claim that the British tabloid violated her privacy by publishing a letter she sent to her estranged father. https://t.co/2JowRUJYjq
Breaking News: President Biden is expected to unveil a winter Covid plan today that includes insurance reimbursement for at-home tests and new travel protocols. https://t.co/z4nw6HSrEW

The first Israeli to test positive for the Omicron variant interacted with dozens of people. Only one has tested positive since.
The results have given some experts cautious hope that triple-vaccinated people may not be as vulnerable as was first feared. https://t.co/b1tSv6Ny63

The Supreme Court's six-member conservative majority appears divided about whether to overrule Roe v. Wade entirely. If they were to do so, at least 20 of the 50 U.S. states will immediately or in short order make almost all abortions unlawful. https://t.co/I5p3mVgXVX

During his 2018 confirmation hearing, Justice Brett Kavanaugh declared that he considered Roe to be settled law, winning him the crucial support of Senator Susan Collins. A reversal by him would be politically explosive, says @hillhulse.
Listen live: https://t.co/dPjpquzIgH

Breaking News: A 15-year-old boy was charged with terrorism and first-degree murder in connection with the Michigan school shooting that left at least four students dead on Tuesday. Officials are considering charges against his parents. https://t.co/qymSqjcQHf
Breaking News: President Biden will extend a mask mandate for travelers on airplanes, trains and buses, a person familiar with the decision said. https://t.co/Jx3Ccaf0ea
Marcus Lamb, a Christian broadcaster in Dallas who had been dismissive of Covid-19 vaccinations, died on Tuesday after contracting the coronavirus, his family said. https://t.co/lxwS1q6n4A

Justice Clarence Thomas asked if there's a constitutional right to abortion, saying it's not spelled out the way the Second Amendment is.
"It's liberty, your honor," Julie Rikelman, the litigation director at the Center for Reproductive Rights, replied.https://t.co/SfiUn06cz1 https://t.co/VBhFTUALjI

Alec Baldwin said in an upcoming television interview that he did not pull the trigger of the gun that fired a live round on the set of the film "Rust," killing the film’s cinematographer and wounding its director. https://t.co/tKSzUS9HCA

The Tucson Police Department moved to fire a police officer after he was captured on video fatally shooting a man in a wheelchair who was suspected of stealing a toolbox from a Walmart and flashing a knife. https://t.co/4DlQIPRzcc

The UN secretary general expressed strong criticism of the international response to the Omicron variant, saying that the rush to close borders has especially penalized African nations where the variant was first detected and vaccines were slow to arrive. https://t.co/Y1aMlbZ8US https://t.co/EGfmQbyHd6
